attributes.action: STOP basing student loans on parental income
attributes.additional_details:
The cost of living whilst at university is sky high, with very little help from the government. Young 'adults' depending on their parents to support them through university is ludicrous. A basic example: student loan (£3600)... student accommodation (£5500) straight away, said student is £1900 short without a basic food/living allowance.

A loan should be a loan. Based on the individuals needs,  rather than parental income.

There are many other issues which need altering too; in regards to how the loan is calculated.

No consideration for how many other children at home.
Financial status of home.
